column2: Hello Jill. Unfortunately we don't have any services that would fit for such a short time period. With luck, maybe a there will be a hotspot near by! ^LD
Hello Mario. Quebec is outside our service area, however you can try reaching out to Shaw Direct and they may be able to get you set up! ^LD
Hello Ty_soup, sorry to hear your having a poor experience with our reps. Is there anything we can assist you with here, we would be happy to help. ^LD
Ok, if you can follow and DM us, I'd like to see about escalating this to be looked into for you. ^LD
Are you able to try connecting to ShawOpen and see if you have similar results? ^LD
Hello Nick, very sorry to hear your install didn't go well! If you follow and DM us we would be happy to take a look into this for you. ^LD
Hmm, is it multiple locations that this happens with or mostly one hotspot that you've noticed? ^LD
Hello KarenDavidsonZachary. Depending on your package, it could be added on for $3/month. If you follow and DM us, we can take a look for you. ^LD
Try unregistering your device through My Shaw, then register it again here https://www. shaw.ca/wifi/get-conne cted/ … . Is this the only device that seems to have trouble connecting? ^LD
Hello FelixLee. Sorry to hear your having trouble with connecting to Shaw Passpoint. Is this the first time trying to connect or were you using it previously? ^LD

Hi Rebecca. Spotty wifi can certainly be frustrating. Could I have your address or account number please? As you wrote, you've contacted us before on this but perhaps another set of eyes can help. ^Lance
Double uh oh! Best to find a DM with an address. Let's see if there are any area issues. ^Lance
Hi Lisa. Uh oh, not a good thing before the big game! I'm not aware of any issues in Kelowna. Could you follow and DM one of their addresses please? ^Lance
^Lance pic.twitter.com/fOI3szQHTx
Could you follow and DM me your address or email address? I can put in a request for you. ^Lance
Hi Angus. It just came out and we've been getting some good feedback on it so far. Cousins can be mean! ^Lance
If they're disappearing, it might be possible to recover them but we don't archive. If you right click your recycle bin to recover old emails, are any of them there? ^Lance
Hi Dave. We wouldn't have any once they're deleted. Are you sending them from http:// webmail.shaw.ca or from a phone app or computer program? ^Lance

Hey, can you delete the tweets with your account info and pin. This is a public conversation and certainly do not recommend having that open to the public. You can DM me by clicking here: http:// bit.ly/2se4NVH and sending me a message. ^Harvey

Hey Robert! Per http:// bit.ly/2zFSJ2Y it should be available from the 23rd. As for the Firelog channel, do you see a error? If not, DM me your account info and I can check into this. ^Harvey https:// twitter.com/messages/compo se?recipient_id=216808077 …
Okay, that works too! I'm sure we'll get this working for you. ^Lance
^Lance pic.twitter.com/mVFcD0QswZ
They'll be on channel 922 and 935 until January 6. Fire log and its virtual warmth will be channel 199. ^Lance
Ha, that's odd. Could you follow and DM me your address please? Let's take a look at your HD box for you. ^Lance
In that case, we're just days away! ^Lance

I have a RCA TV at home too. It's a good TV but RCA doesn't actually make their own. They have so many different companies that make them and then they slap the RCA name on them. No consistency on parts. ^Lance
Happy to help! The TV must have been having a struggle understanding the signal from the box. But at least they're completed their 'handshake' now and are talking as they should! ^Lance

Hi Robert. You require a subscription to TSN to watch it. Then you can watch it on any TSN channel, http://www. tsn.ca/live and the Shaw FreeRange TV app. But sorry, not streaming on the internet without that TV subscription to TSN. ^Lance
Sounds like the signal cutting out. Could you follow/DM your address please? I'll see if it's an area issue or signal to your box. ^Lance

Hi Cari. To help you get into the holiday spirit, you can find them on channels 461 and 462. If you have BlueSky TV, they will available within the next few days. https:// community.shaw.ca/docs/DOC-9463 ^Lance
Hi Geri. With the big game later today too! What issues are you having? Are channels showing? ^Lance
For football fans, it's Stanley Cup level! ^Lance
Hi William. The Grey Cup is on all TSN channels today! ^Lance
Hmm, have you pulled the box and the TV's power cords for 10 seconds? Also, taken off and reconnected the HDMI cable between the two? Possible it's the TV translating the signal funny. ^Lance
Sometimes it just needs that extra push! Good that it's working again for you now! ^Lance
Hi Kyle. Wow, I haven't seen that before! Is it also there when you push the guide button on the remote or is it only when you're watching a channel? ^Lance
Could you follow and DM your address or account number please? I would like to refresh the box for you. ^Lance
Hmm, should be something by now. Are you able to watch the channels? ^Lance
Hi Renee. It can take a few minutes for the guide to populate, especially if you have an older box. Is it showing no info or the wrong info? ^Lance
That would depend on our licensing agreement with the app provider. Hopefully we do get that feature in the future! ^Lance
With the app, you are able stream live or to add it to your 'watchlist' to stream it later. But downloading content to your phone for later viewing isn't available. ^Lance
Hi Lori, That's why a virtual fire log burning is the best! ^Lance

If you'll permit me to wax poetic for a few sentences -- For CFL fans, Grey Cup is the culmination of many months of football hopes and dreams! It's the end of a season, the birth of the next, and the pushing hard of two great teams! (has that for poetry?) ^Lance
Hi Meh. Uh oh, no Frame? Is it not there at all or is it crackling sounds but no picture? ^Lance
Ah, the East/West curse. Also, a lot of people from Edmonton are rooting for Toronto just to see Calgary lose! A bitter but fun to watch rivalry! ^Lance
Let's take a look at your internet signal. Could you DM and confirm your address or account number please? Thanks! ^Lance
Hi Em. As long as you're subscribed to the Movie Network with your cable TV service, you should have access to the TMN Go app. Are you having a login issue? ^Lance
Good morning! Lance, Courtney and Phil on for another fun-filled morning. And don't forget today is CFL Grey Cup day. For you CFL fans, are your bets on Calgary or Toronto?
Hey Twitter friends, your evening crew is signing off for the night and will be back at 7 AM PT to help. Hope you have a great evening. Good night
Hey Trevor, there is a service interruption in your area and technicians are investigating. Please follow http:// bit.ly/2AAvfMI for more information and updates. ^TD
Awesome! Keep me posted. ^TD
Ah. If possible, can you test to record the next show on A&E to see if the problem continues? Let me know how it goes. ^TD
Can you press the record button for it to resume recording or does it still intermittently become a black screen? ^TD
Hey Sandi, the feed looks good on my end here. Can you see the guide information and is that the only channel that is blacked out? ^TD
Is it not loading the full 1080p based on the options you have selected in the settings for Netflix or is the content not in HD? ^TD
There is a possibility of an area issue. If I can get your account number or address of service I can take a look for you. ^LD
I certainly want to take a further look. Please DM me your home address and phone number. ^TD https:// twitter.com/messages/compo se?recipient_id=216808077 …
Oh no! I would love to help. Are you noticing slow speeds over WiFi only or is connections directly connections through ethernet affected as well? ^TD
Hello Jaxson, sorry to hear your Internet is down! Lets see if we can find out what the cause is and get you back online. On the front of the Shaw modem, what lights are on solid? ^LD

Hello Lynn. Not all businesses are set up as a ShawOpen hotspot, however for any locations that would be beneficial, you can fill out the Suggest a Location from our site here https:// community.shaw.ca/docs/DOC-10516 ^LD
pic.twitter.com/O0F3lRXLiQ

Hello Andlynoch, that is correct, that would be a fraudulent popup. Normally if we have any kind of survey, it would be while visiting our site or Online Community. This also doesn't have the Shaw) logo, so that's also an indicator that it's not from us. ^LD
I will certainly send your feedback to our WiFi teams on your specific location so they can further investigate into this. ^TD
Hey Derick, I haven't heard of troubles with Shaw Open Hotspots. Are you in a static location while connected or on the move? ^TD
Perfect! Glad that was able to fix that. Let me know if you have any other questions. ^TD

Sounds great! Keep me posted ^TD
Sounds good. Keep me posted if you need any immediate help. ^TD
Hey Darcy, a professional installation is required for BlueSky TV. You will not be able to pick one up at your local Shaw store. Let me know if you need help setting up an appointment for one. ^TD
Hi! That error message could be an issue on our end. May I have your home address and phone number so I may take a further look? Are you seeing this on multiple TV sets or just one? ^TD
There shouldn't be any major hold times. I can certainly help you here. Let me know what I can do for you. ^TD
Hi Shannon, how are you today? How can I help? ^TD
Sweet! Glad to hear that worked well for you. Let me know if you have any other questions. ^TD pic.twitter.com/jRGdVuPEnR
Can you DM me a screen shot of the error message you see? ^TD https:// twitter.com/messages/compo se?recipient_id=216808077 …

Yes, I will suggest changing your WiFi channel to one that gives you the best speeds. If that still does not help, I would love to take a further look. DM me your home address and phone number. ^TD https:// twitter.com/messages/compo se?recipient_id=216808077 …
That is very odd, it might be your search history that is maxed out. Do you see the same error message if you use a different browser such as Chrome or Firefox? ^TD

I can certainly help build a package for you. Please send me a DM with your home address and postal code so I can check into service availability. ^TD https:// twitter.com/messages/compo se?recipient_id=216808077 …
I can help you here. Please DM me your home address and phone number along with your inquiry. Thanks. ^TD https:// twitter.com/messages/compo se?recipient_id=216808077 …

Great. Keep me posted. ^TD
I will suggest to update your WiFi channel for the 5Ghz network to 36 or 48 with the steps: https:// community.shaw.ca/docs/DOC-1046 . Let me know how that goes. ^TD

Can you give the modem a quick power reset by unplugging it for one minute? Once it powers back up, it will take 5-8 minutes to fully come online. Let me know if you still notice the same slow speeds on WiFi. ^TD
What is your specific area and what troubleshooting steps have you tried so far? ^TD

Are you connected to the 2.4 Ghz network or the 5 Ghz network? Also, is the modem near any fish tanks, television sets or home phone sets (this may cause WiFi interference) What troubleshooting steps have you tried so far? ^TD
Hey Darren, no reports of troubles in Winnipeg. Are you noticing issues with connections directly connected via ethernet to the modem as well or is it only WiFi? ^TD
hahah, fair! Give us a shout back if we can assist again. :) ^Harvey

Night crew is off on this rainy Friday night in Van! Hope you guys had a killer shopping day with dem crazy Black Friday deals :) We'll return at 7am PT tomorrow to pick up where we left off. Have a good one folks!

Hmm, if not showing, and if the regular network is working, can you try a factory reset to it? To do so, hold down pinhole reset button at back for at least 45s before letting go ^Ken
Hmm, I don't see it being restarted in the past month, approx 25 days straight, can you try again? Leave it unplugged for at least 1 min before reconnecting. ^Ken
Sorry to hear that. Troubleshooting wise, what have you tried so far? ^Ken

In order to get to that menu, you would need to start with the cable box powered on. Then, press pwr and almost immediately press Ok/select on remote; may take a couple tries. Once in, should be option d05; HOST NAME is what you should see, with the serial number. ^Ken

Thanks for trying; any luck with it, after it was reset? If not, there's another way to locate serial number: Press pwr on remote, then immediately press ok/select on remote. Should bring up a white menu (may need to try couple times). Let me know when you're there ^Ken
If it's only happening to one of a few in your home, can you DM us the serial number so that I can take a look? If haven't tried, rebooting it should usually solve odd quirks that you see. ^Ken
Hmm, just the one cable box that's affected? Or if you have multiples, same issue on that channel across all TVs? ^Ken
Instead of using OBS, have you tried going through YouTube directly or tried alternative programs? Unfortunately , this is a bit out of our support scope. ^Ken
Hey Arlene! Would you be able to give me some context as to what's happening please? ^Ken
Hey Lianne, correct on channel 302/326! ^Ken
Sorry to hear that it's still occurring. Example would be best referred to YouTube's support to see if there are other settings/optimizations available for OBS. ^Ken
Sorry to hear! Any error messages shown on screen? All TVs in home or just a specific one? ^Ken
I think he rotates between multiples of the same shirt; but then again, being the fire dude is a full-time gig, no time to change clothes on some nights :) ^Ken
Factory reset would revert any custom settings that you had back to factory defaults. If ok with that, hold pinhole reset button at back of modem for at least 45s before letting go. ^Ken
Hey Jeannette, if you ever need a hand, always here to listen :) Cheers! ^Ken
Pretty old tweet that you're referencing Chris :) If you need a hand, please let us know how we can help anytime. Cheers! ^Ken
Results look fine; would suggest rebooting modem if haven't tried. Factory reset may be needed to see if that helps improve. Area wise, nothing at this time suggesting upload saturation. ^Ken

What services are you streaming to specifically? Do you have any trace routes collected? Tried adjusting bitrate settings? ^Ken

I recommend that you try a direct connection, comp to modem only, and try to recreate the issue/observe during your reported time, to see if any changes/improvements. ^Ken
Troubleshooting wise, what has been tried so far? Are you using own router for sharing the internet in the home (wireless)? ^Ken
We're here to assist on Twitter if you like; alternatively, we're also on Facebook Messenger too ^Ken
